channel.title: Descriptive-Phonetics on Hugh's Curriculum Vitae
channel.description: Recent content in Descriptive-Phonetics on Hugh's Curriculum Vitae

item.title: Asimjeeg Datooga (Southern Nilotic, Tanzania) ASR
item.description: This work has no written results yet. It is purely experimental at this stage.

item.title: Chepang (Nepal) ASR
item.description: This work has no written results yet. It is purely experimental at this stage.

item.title: Tentative: [Phonetic Description of Khroskyabs]
item.description: This is an early sketch of an Yu Lha’s home variety. Our goal is to model an Illustration of the IPA.

item.title: UÌ t-Ma'in (Nigeria) ASR
item.description: This work has no written results yet. It is purely experimental at this stage.

item.title: Automatic Speech Recognition
item.description: Working with several collaborators on Automatic Speech Recognition for low-resource tone languages.

item.title: Tentative: [Phonetic Description of an Italian dialect]
item.description: This is an early sketch of an Sara’s home variety. Our goal is to model an Illustration of the IPA.

item.title: Phonetic transcription of tone in the IPA
item.description: This was a poster presentation presented at the 18th International Conference of Phonetic Sciences in 2015. Links are to the poster and the 5 page paper is in the conference proceedings. Citeable as: Hugh J. Paterson III (2015) Phonetic transcription of tone in the IPA. In The Scottish Consortium for ICPhS 2015 (Ed.). Proceedings of the 18th International Conference of Phonetic Sciences Paper number 507.1-5. University of Glasgow: Glasgow, UK.

item.title: Interdental approximant
item.description: An investigation and description of a rare and socially stigmatized speech sound where the tongue protrudes out of the mouth.
